title: Remove error from test log

Closes https://github.com/exonum/exonum/issues/127

This pr just remove most of `logger::init()` in tests.
Every test should be self-reproducible, so we don't need debug output's in master for tests.

There still some logs in `events/tests.rs` left, waiting for https://github.com/exonum/exonum/pull/300

Additionally removes old profiler tests code.

title: Fix Network discover failure
body:
Closes https://github.com/exonum/exonum/issues/73

With `PollOpt::edge()` mio could ignore connection events, if they appear in one short period.

https://carllerche.github.io/mio/mio/struct.Poll.html#edge-triggered-and-level-triggered

title: Make panic message cleaner.
body:
Closes https://github.com/exonum/exonum/issues/232

I am using `set_hook` here, instead of `catch_unwind` because I need to prevent printing default panic message in `std::*::default_hook`.

The message will look like
```
➜  exonum-configuration git:(cargo-toml) ✗ ./target/debug/examples/configuration 
error: Subcommand not found

```
instead of 
```
➜  exonum-configuration git:(cargo-toml) ✗ ./target/debug/examples/configuration 
thread 'main' panicked at 'Subcommand not found', /Users/vladimirmotylenko/bitfury/exonum/exonum/src/helpers/fabric/clap_backend.rs:84
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
```

Cons: 
 1. User can't print backtrace for cmd parsing now. (but he shouldn't want it)
 2. We can add color, or other marks, to increase usability
 3. It only catch and prints `String` represented exceptions.

title: Update dependencies without breaking changes
body:
* Trying to update `mio` introduce breaking changes due using `tokio` project - still on `0.5` version
* `params` crate still rely on `body-parser 0.5.0` and `serde-*-0.8.x` family due more than half year not released `iron`

In general, it's good practice keep dependencies up to date :)

Move `config` module into `helpers`. We can also remove `config` folder and keep the module in the root, but I think `helpers` module is a better place.

It's a breaking change, because `ConfigFile` is a public struct and https://github.com/exonum/exonum-btc-anchoring uses it.

```none
   Compiling hyper v0.10.12

warning: unused imports: `SystemTime`, `UNIX_EPOCH`

12 | use std::time::{Instant, SystemTime, UNIX_EPOCH};

   |
   = note: #[warn(unused_imports)] on by default

   Compiling phf_codegen v0.7.21
```
Do we really need this imports?

title: Fix double execute
body:
should fix https://github.com/exonum/exonum-core/issues/185

Block could be executed two times:
1. When we `lock` on some `Propose` in `handle_prevote`
2. When we get enough precommits in `handle_precommit`

This workaround could be removed, "lazy block evaluation" implemnation, If such will be.

In config, if no `external_address` set, it should fallback, to `listener_address`

For now I created `NodeBuilder` object which incapsulate all work with `cmd` and running node.
This is probably "basic" of future `ExonumApplication`

Additionally I implement `ServiceFactory` helper, which used to create service, which given config (without end-user code).


title: Add timeout adjuster implementation controlled by ConsensusConfig

labels.name: discussion :speech_balloon:
labels.description: The design isn't finalized yet, feel free to participate in the discussion.

body:
Currently `propose_timeout` value from `ConsensusConfig` has no effect on propose timeout, because it is controlled solely by `TimeoutAdjuster` implementation.

There are several questions: 
1. A better name for `FromConsensusConfig` timeout adjuster.
2. Do we need at all separate `FromConsensusConfig` and `Constant` implementations or should `Constant` timeout use value from `ConsensusConfig`?
3. Should `MovingAverage` timeout somehow depend on `ConsensusConfig` too?

title: Apply breaking changes of storage refactoring
body:
This PR apply future changes to the key representation for `ListTable` and `MerkleTable`.

**Breaking Changes** in code:

- `MerkleTable<T, K, V>` converted to `MerkleTable<T, V>`
- `ListTable<T, K, V>` converted to `ListTable<T, V>`
- All keys are always `u64`

**Rationale:**

- I do not think that we should be given the opportunity to choose the size of the key for the lists and not cause the situation "640 kb are enough for everything"
- The code is much simpler and `num` dependency are removed
- For Merkle table, the number of intermediate allocations is reduced (technically not relevant for this PR, but will work in the future PR with `StorageKey` trait)

**How this work:**

For `ListTable` just always use 8 bytes for keys, the layout is the same. For `MerkleTable`, key serialization is a little tricky. The key size is surprisingly 8 bytes too and for every node is defined as: 

```
(height << 58) + index
```

The idea is to use first 6 bits of a key for height and least 58 bits for an index. This means that **the size of the Merkle tree is limited by 2^58 elements**. The maximum height of a tree is 59 and it fits in 6 bits. The lexicographic order of the nodes is the same.

Currently, this code looks scary because of the removal of `num` dependency (e.g. `...(1 * 1) + 1`). The reason I do not want to improve this is I've completely rewritten these implementations in a separate branch.

title: Separate keys for signing consensus messages and transactions

labels.name: discussion :speech_balloon:
labels.description: The design isn't finalized yet, feel free to participate in the discussion.

body:
Fixes #62.

:warning: Although changes are straightforward and trivial, this is a breaking change for (all?) services as they now should use `txs`-keys for own transactions. Still, fix should be simple.

I'm not sure about several things, so please take a look and comment. Among other things I don't like keys naming (`consensus_..._key` and `txs_..._key`). 
Another point to consider - how to better restrict services from using the wrong pair of keys.

title: add info on transaction's  block height and index within block to schema
Combine public/private API endpoints from services
body:
Closes #66. 

**Breaking Changes!**

 - Adds `service_name` getter to `Service` trait. Services must implement this function.
 - `Node::run` now starts the api threads according to `NodeApiConfiguration` 
 - Endpoints for explorer api now have a prefix `/api/explorer/v1/` instead of `/api/v1/blockchain_explorer`. 
 - Endpoint for services now have a prefix `/api/services/{service_name}`. 

Just implement `private_api_handler` and `public_api_handler` for `Service` trait and use `Node::run` for launching application. Public and private apis will be launch automaticaly.

Implementation [example](https://github.com/exonum/exonum-configuration/pull/22):

title: Refactor storage_values! and message!
body:
- [X]  Add implementation for `Vec<Field>`
- [X]  Add check for spaces between segments.
- [x] Make code more generic, remove repetition in body of `message!` and `storage_value!`
- [x] Synchronize implementation of serialization\deserialization

Closes https://github.com/exonum/exonum-core/issues/17

Since it's breaking change, there are list of repositories that should be ready for this pr:
- [x] `exonum-configuration` in https://github.com/exonum/exonum-configuration/pull/30
- [x] `cryptocurrency` in https://github.com/exonum/cryptocurrency/pull/36
- [x] `exonum-btc-anchoring` in https://github.com/exonum/exonum-btc-anchoring/pull/56
